sentence.Network_en: The pope must speak ex cathedra for an encyclical to be infallible.
sentence.Network_cn: 教皇必须权威地指出教谕是没有错误的.

sentence.Network_en: Encyclical funeral oration after carved stone, still stand today east streams Jiang Ancestral Hall Lane.
sentence.Network_cn: 谕祭文后被刻成石碑, 今仍立于东溪村姜氏宗祠里.

list.abs: 只有罗马天主教宗若望二十三世在他1963年4月的《和平于世通谕》(the encyclical Pacem in Terris)中，[93]对现代人权规范的完整范围，给出了的神学上很明智的直接建立在人的神圣尊严的原理之上的支持。.

list.exp: 竖笛最高等独奏家文凭
list.abs: ...荣、音乐曲式分析学DEM文凭，并进入法国巴黎市立拉威尔音乐院之钢琴伴奏班。2000年获布隆尼音乐院，竖笛最高等独奏家文凭(encycle Pefectionnement)及竖笛室内乐文凭，并获拉威尔音乐院室内乐钢琴演奏文凭。1999 年获法国贝隆音乐大赛竖笛第二名、法国.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (as an adjective): via late Latin from Greek enkuklios 'circular, general', from en- 'in' + kuklos 'a circle'

entry.def: An encyclical is an official letter written by the Pope and sent to all Roman Catholic bishops, usually in order to make a statement about the official teachings of the Church.

means.word_mean: 1. a letter from the pope sent to all Roman Catholic bishops throughout the world

auth_sentence.content: The encyclical doesn't attack capitalism or offer models for nations to adopt.
auth_sentence.res_content: The encyclical doesn't attack capitalism or offer models for nations to adopt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The encyclical doesn't attack capitalism or offer models for nations to adopt.

auth_sentence.content: Yet his encyclical contains no talk of seeking a third way between markets and socialism.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet his encyclical contains no talk of seeking a third way between markets and socialism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet his encyclical contains no talk of seeking a third way between markets and socialism.

auth_sentence.content: In 1967, Pope Paul VI issued the encyclical Sacerdotalis Caelibatus, reaffirming the traditional law on celibacy.
auth_sentence.res_content: In 1967, Pope Paul VI issued the encyclical Sacerdotalis Caelibatus, reaffirming the traditional law on celibacy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In 1967, Pope Paul VI issued the encyclical Sacerdotalis Caelibatus, reaffirming the traditional law on celibacy.
